Package Grupo45.Projeto

Class Condition

java.lang.Object
Grupo45.Projeto.Condition
public class Condition
extends java.lang.Object
Date May 07-2021 This class represents a Conditions that can be used by a Rule Object to evaluate Code Smells. A Condition represents a logical expression
Version:
1.0
Author:
G45, Andre Amado, Guilherme Henriques, JoÃ£o Guerra, Miguel Nunes, Francisco Mendes, Tiago Geraldo

    Constructors

    Condition​(java.lang.String s)

    This constructor creates a condition when given a metric, a signal and an int value

  • Constructor Details

    • Condition

      public Condition​(java.lang.String metric, java.lang.String signal, int n)
      This constructor creates a condition when given a metric, a signal and an int value
      Parameters:
      metric - is the metric to be used in the condition
      signal - is the signal to be used in the condition
      n - is the int value to be used in the condition

    • Condition

      public Condition​(java.lang.String s)
      This constructor creates a condition, when given a String in a specific format that uses ':' to separate the information. Example: Metric:Signal:Value
      Parameters:
      s - is the String to be used to create the condition

  • Method Details

    • evaluate

      public boolean evaluate​(int x)
      Given an int value, this method checks if the value is within the condition parameters
      Parameters:
      x - is the value to be tested in the condition
      Returns:
      returns a boolean that represents if the given value is in the condition (true) or not (false)

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the class
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • getMetric

      public java.lang.String getMetric()
      Returns:
      returns the metric of the condition

    • getSignal

      public java.lang.String getSignal()
      Returns:
      returns the logical signal of the condition

    • getLimit

      public java.lang.String getLimit()
      Returns:
      returns the limit value of the condition as a String
